messages.text: Crash reports are looking good today, well done to us I suppose!

messages.text: :tada:
We actually have zero crash reports on insider for 1.1.17! Amazing

messages.text: I'm pushing it out to the release channel immediately.

elements.text: I'm pushing it out to the release channel immediately.

messages.text: Sooo, how do we proceed? I think we could either a) continue to fix the long tail of bugs we're seeing on crash reporting, or b) say this is good enough for now and open things up for new feature merges. I'm indifferent :slightly_smiling_face: But it does seem that we still have a number of crash reports that might be easy to fix, so that if we did 1-2 more releases in the a) spirit we could _really_ get our crash report count down?

elements.text: Sooo, how do we proceed? I think we could either a) continue to fix the long tail of bugs we're seeing on crash reporting, or b) say this is good enough for now and open things up for new feature merges. I'm indifferent
But it does seem that we still have a number of crash reports that might be easy to fix, so that if we did 1-2 more releases in the a) spirit we could
really
get our crash report count down?

messages.text: In terms of features, I'll try to take a look again at the cloud indexing and what we still need there. I think on the client side things are in pretty good shape, right? Should we say the cloud download is the thing that if that is done we ship the next minor version?

elements.text: In terms of features, I'll try to take a look again at the cloud indexing and what we still need there. I think on the client side things are in pretty good shape, right? Should we say the cloud download is the thing that if that is done we ship the next minor version?

messages.text: I think there are two things to do: a) replace all `get_offset` with `get_offset2`, and then we also have a bug now with `get_offset2`, but I think that is actually just an invalid `getModuleAt` request where we are getting a request for a line that doesn't exist...

get_offset
with

get_offset2

getModuleAt
request where we are getting a request for a line that doesn't exist...

messages.text: 800 users so far for 1.1.17, and only 7 experienced a crash in the LS :slightly_smiling_face: Looking at the crash reports, my guess is that we could fairly easily fix half of them. The other half might be a bit more tricky or out of our control.

elements.text: 800 users so far for 1.1.17, and only 7 experienced a crash in the LS
Looking at the crash reports, my guess is that we could fairly easily fix half of them. The other half might be a bit more tricky or out of our control.

messages.text: I tried the new issue reporting integration from the crash reporting site. I think this might be useful to track things. We can essentially track issues from crash reporting at <https://github.com/julia-vscode/crashreporting-issues/issues> now.

now.

messages.text: That repo is private, so that we don't have to worry about anonymizing stuff there.
